main event: On December 13th, 1955, in Caddo Lake, Louisiana, a radar blip was observed drifting in a northeasterly direction, appearing similar to two aircraft flying very close in formation.
interesting points: The object was oblong in shape and of normal size for an aircraft sighting.
The sighting lasted for five minutes and was observed by Captain Lloyd Wentworth, a reliable radar observer from the 513th Bomb Squadron.
At the time of the sighting, the weather conditions were clear with no moon, and the winds were easterly at 15 to 25 knots.
The object was initially called to the crew's attention by the Barksdale Tower and was last seen passing beneath the observing aircraft in a magnetic heading of 153 degrees.
The report suggests that it could have been a possible balloon sighting due to the wind conditions at 6,000 feet.
sighted object: Oblong-shaped object drifting in a northeasterly direction
witnesses: Captain Lloyd Wentworth, a reliable radar observer
